4:47.race_name: Voluntary Action Leicestershire (VAL) Celebrating 60 Years Handicap
4:47.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Commanding Prince
runners.comment: Bang there in two 1m handicaps; blinkers replace cheekpieces and hard to rule out
runners.spotlight: Dual novice winner, at 1m then 7f; close up in two 1m handicaps, looking likely to win in the new cheekpieces at Ayr (good to firm) until collared late on; drops to 7f with blinkers now tried and hard to rule out.

runners.name: Sword
runners.comment: 1m2f winner; too free over 7f on return and stable debut; now hooded
runners.spotlight: Signed off for the Gosdens with a 1m2f novice win at Newcastle (AW); bought for 55,000gns and never gave himself a chance at York (7f) by racing too freely; the hood is an interesting addition but it remains to be seen if this is his trip.

runners.name: Liamarty Dreams
runners.comment: Without a win in 13 months; his fourth at Chester two runs back could prove a false dawn
runners.spotlight: Over a year since the last of his six career wins; shaped as though his turn might be near when fourth in first-time cheekpieces at Chester (7f, good) but that looks a false dawn having failed to build on that at Thirsk; downgraded here but comes with risks.

runners.name: Chalk Mountain
runners.comment: The nagging concern is that all five wins and best form has been on the AW
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick in 7f AW handicaps last autumn and was bang there after a break at Kempton last month; the nagging concern is that all five wins and best form has been on the AW.

runners.name: Jungle Land
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: 2-12; arrives here in pretty good nick but has stamina to prove over 7f
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two; won a 6f maiden last year and doubled his tally in an AW handicap over that trip in March; not far away in either run since but has stamina to prove over 7f (went off too fast when he tried it once before).

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Wolverhampton and was just unlucky to bump into one. He could be out again this week, and he might also go to Lingfield on April 18 for a £65,000 handicap. He's a fun handicapper for the summer. 07-04-25

runners.name: Manhattan Mirage
runners.comment: Showed promise in the Amo colours and has dropped to a realistic mark for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in three of his seven races in the Amo Racing silks and sold on for 26,000gns; this is his first handicap but he's dropped to a realistic mark and new trainer fits a hood; not discounted with Rossa Ryan booked.

stable_tour.quote: Another by Inns Of Court, he will be ready around July time. He is a really useful horse and is a half-brother to the owner's Persian Force, winner of last year's Brocklesby. 10-05-23

runners.name: Infinity Blue
runners.comment: Rallying third over Musselburgh's 7f a month ago; this stiffer track looks favourable
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in his one hurdle run for David Pipe and swiftly returned to former yard; ran well when a rallying third at Musselburgh (7f, good) a month ago and this stiffer track should be in his favour.

4:17.race_name: Dale Hall & Hickman Associates EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
4:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Kurios George
runners.comment: Keen early and weakened to be beaten 22l at Doncaster; hood retained and now gelded
runners.spotlight: Keen early and weakened to be beaten 22l at Doncaster (7f, good to firm; 22-1); the hood is retained and he's since been gelded; enough to prove.

runners.name: Archivist
runners.comment: Has an edge in experience over his rivals and also brings the best form
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in his last three races for Sir Michael Stoute, finishing some way ahead of New York Minute the final time on heavy ground at Nottingham (1m); again second there on reappearance (good) and that run can be upgraded as he finished well after a troubled run; the one to beat.

runners.name: Brave Guest
runners.comment: Second foal out of a 6f winner (RPR 75), herself a half-sister to two winners
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a 6f winner (RPR 75), herself a half-sister to two winners; makes sense to check the betting.

runners.name: Clouds Hill
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Encouraging front-running second on debut but that form has taken some knocks
runners.spotlight: Had no excuses from the front at Musselburgh (1m, good; 17-2) and that form has taken some knocks; open to improvement after one start but will need to find some.

runners.name: King Of The Sea
runners.comment: Nice pedigree but big odds for both his races (on good) and hasn't shown a lot
runners.spotlight: Nice pedigree but big odds for both his races (on good) and hasn't shown a lot (latterly in a hood); may find his level in handicaps.

runners.name: New York Minute
runners.comment: Promising debut and then encountered heavy ground; now gelded; retains potential
runners.spotlight: 400,000euros yearling; shaped quite well after starting slowly on debut (1m, good) and heavy ground was perhaps not ideal second time out; retains plenty of potential and has been gelded.

runners.name: Silent Storm
runners.owner: J Kimber, J Savory, A Ocallaghan
runners.comment: Got outpaced before rallying into fourth at Newbury (7f, good); should improve
runners.spotlight: 90,000euros yearling and brother to three winners; got outpaced before rallying into fourth at Newbury (7f, good) and that was an encouraging start; should improve.

runners.name: Sunshine Mag
runners.comment: It was a good race in which he was beaten 9l at Newmarket; has a future
runners.spotlight: Positives to take from AW debut (7f) and it was a good race in which he was beaten 9l at Newmarket (1m, good); might not be up to winning this but he's one to keep an eye on for another day.

runners.name: Towerlands
runners.comment: Modest form in two races for James Ferguson and moved on for 11,500gns
runners.spotlight: Second run for James Ferguson was better than the first but was still only midfield at Kempton (7f) and wore blinkers; moved on for 11,500gns and now gelded; handicaps will be more like it.

runners.name: Zouligan
runners.comment: Inexperience very evident when eighth of 11 runners at Newbury (7f, good; 40-1)
runners.spotlight: Inexperience very evident when eighth of 11 at Newbury (7f, good; 40-1); appeals as one for further down the line.

runners.name: Charming Princess
runners.owner: Hrh Prince Faisal Bin Khaled & Najd Stud
runners.comment: Wootton Bassett filly who cost 300,000gns as a yearling; intriguing newcomer
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett filly who cost 300,000gns as a yearling; half-sister to Listed-placed 7f-1m winner Northern Express (RPR 112); dam Group-placed 6f-1m winner (105) and sister to Listed-placed 1m2f/11.4f winner Songbird; intriguing newcomer and the market will be instructive with the stable also represented by New York Minute.

runners.name: Dinah Myte
runners.comment: Newcomer and others are far more appealing on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-sister to winners Intercessor (7f-1m2f; RPR 83) and First Encounter (1m turf/1m2f; 53); dam once-raced daughter of Group-placed 6f 2yo winning half-sister to 6f Listed winner Lady Links; unlikely to provide the answer on her debut.

runners.name: Quite Sweet
runners.breeder: Haras D'La Riviere, Mme Liza Judd
runners.comment: 5,000euros yearling; second foal; dam 7f winner (RPR 63)
runners.spotlight: 5,000euros yearling; second foal; dam 7f winner (RPR 63), sister to 6f/7f winner Dancecase; very opposable first time out.

5:17.race_name: Dark Horse Ladies' Day Saturday 5th July Handicap
5:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Flickering Halo
runners.comment: Only 1lb higher than for last month's AW win (1m2f); should be in the thick of it again
runners.spotlight: Both wins over 1m2f but stays this far; only raised 1lb for last month's narrow Newcastle success and every reason to think he will be in the thick of it once again.

runners.name: Squeezebox
runners.comment: 1m4f win last summer off 2lb lower; may come on for his return and Rossa Ryan booked
runners.spotlight: Successful over this trip at Southwell last summer off 2lb lower; perhaps in need of his return to action at Doncaster last month and Rossa Ryan always a positive booking for the stable.

runners.name: Just An Hour
runners.comment: Easy win on reappearance; held on faster ground at Salisbury since; contender back at 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Off the mark for this stable with an easy win at Nottingham (1m2f, good) in April; only third at Salisbury last month (winner gone in again since) but stepping back up to 1m4f can help.

stable_tour.quote: A horse we bought from Joseph O'Brien last year. He's taken a bit of time to settle, he didn't geld very well and came to us a little bit poor and high in the handicap. He's probably come down to a realistic mark now and hopefully he'll pay his way for the rest of the season. 11-07-24

runners.name: Show Biz Kid
runners.comment: Back on the up this year; some encouragement for stamina and a key player if he stays
runners.spotlight: Back on the up this year, winning a 1m2f handicap at Yarmouth in April and following it with a good second at Pontefract; dam was a 1m3f winner, so today's longer trip may prove to be in range and he should go well if he improves for the extra yardage.

runners.name: Lincoln Rockstar
runners.owner: G P S Heart Of Racing Ltd & Partner

prev_owners.owner: G P S Heart of Racing (Bloodstock) Ltd

runners.comment: C&D win last July was one of five in 2024; struggled this year but revival may be imminent
runners.spotlight: Soared up the weights last summer, winning five times at around this trip (including C&D); tailed off in both runs this year (blew the start latest) but she's back to her last winning mark and Marco Ghiani returns to the saddle (record on her reads 1121217).

quotes.race: Nelson Restaurant For Classic Raceday Dining Handicap
quotes.quote: We knew Lincoln Rockstar was really well but we weren't expecting that. She usually just does enough but she's put six behind them! She hit a flat spot during the race but we didn't expect she'd pick up in the way she did. She's entered at Musselburgh on Tuesday but we'll see how she comes out of this. We had a few races planned but the handicapper might take her off that. We'll have some fun with her - Ivan Furtado, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Giselles Defence
runners.comment: His wins have come on good or slower over 1m2f; fair third latest; needs more to take this
runners.spotlight: Three wins over 1m2f on good or slower in 2024; has run to form over this trip and his latest Chester third was a step up on his reappearance effort.

5:47.race_name: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Self-Hire Wedding Venue Handicap
5:47.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Amerjeet
runners.comment: His AW win last summer is the standout form in nine races; finished last a month ago
runners.spotlight: Had nine starts and the AW win last summer (beating Winchurch over 5f; 3lb higher) is very much the standout; 50-1 and trailed home last at Windsor a month ago; that was in cheekpieces but no great significance in the return of blinkers.

runners.name: Miss Show Down
runners.comment: Bath nursery winner; kept on for fourth at Goodwood and is on a stiffer track here
runners.spotlight: Finished strongly to lead on the line in a Bath nursery (5f, good) and again got outpaced before keeping on when 3l off the winner at Goodwood ten days ago; might well strip fitter for that and this stiffer finish should work in her favour.

stable_tour.quote: She was progressive last year and ended her season by winning at Bath over five furlongs. She'll want quick ground. 17-04-25

runners.name: Winchurch
runners.owner: Sbk Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Dual 5f winner; positive AW runs during the winter and now returns from a break gelded
runners.spotlight: Dual 5f winner, the handicap off 1lb lower on good to firm; there were positive AW runs during the winter and now returns from a break gelded; needs respecting.

runners.name: Invincible Crown
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Viii & Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Behind Rogue Bullet when relegated to a Class 5 at Yarmouth last month
runners.spotlight: 5f winner on the AW but nearer last than first in four runs for current yard and was behind Rogue Bullet when relegated to a Class 5 at Yarmouth last month.

stable_tour.quote: He couldn't get involved at Wolverhampton on Saturday night, hanging left but keeping on into fourth. He's highly strung, so I keep him in the field a lot. 09-04-25

runners.name: Tees Aggregates
runners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock Ltd & The Ivy League
runners.comment: Comfortably drew clear for a second career win over 5f at Catterick 22 days ago; up 6lb
runners.spotlight: Comfortably drew clear for a second career win over 5f at Catterick 22 days ago (good to firm); raised 6lb but the RPR he produced was easily a career best.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Tees Aggregates was too keen and ran himself into the ground last time but today took a lead, he had a nice run through and found plenty - Harrison Shaw, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I got him from the breeze-ups and he's run two good races. He ran a cracker at Doncaster on his debut as he got broadsided but still finished off his race. He then went to Wetherby and again travelled really strongly. He looked like he was going to win before finishing a little tired in third. If he doesn't win his maiden, he should definitely be winning nurseries. 26-07-24

runners.name: Rogue Bullet
runners.comment: Novice winner in April but beaten fair and square in his subsequent handicaps
runners.spotlight: Had nothing in hand when winning a 6f novice at Brighton in April (good to firm) and beaten fair and square in his subsequent handicaps; down 2lb for those but needs to find something.

runners.name: Pont Neuf
runners.comment: Won his first two races as a juvenile but has sharply regressed; now tried in blinkers
runners.spotlight: Essentially disappointing since looking a useful prospect in winning his first two races as a juvenile; ran particularly poorly last time at Windsor when tried in cheekpieces and now has a go in blinkers; risky.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Super Sprint [at Newbury on July 20] the obvious target for Pont Neuf. He's talented but a little bit quirky, so we need to manage him. It's difficult to give away a penalty but experience probably helped him on this ground - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet/EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C & D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mentally Pont Neuf isn't as straightforward as the one who won for me at Chelmsford on Friday. He has the ability to flip, but had never done that [was tricky before the race] at home. I've nothing in mind for him as I don't know if he'd cope with Chester's May meeting - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Style King
runners.comment: Produced a couple of shockers since finishing second at Wolverhampton in April
runners.spotlight: Ex-Roger Varian; appeared to have turned a corner when second on stable debut at Wolverhampton (6f) but has produced a couple of shockers since then (6f/5f); hard to trust.

runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.comment: Still a maiden but placed a good few times and did well to finish so close at Lingfield
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden (0-12) but placed a good few times and did well to finish so close at Lingfield (5f, good to firm) having raced freely in the new cheekpieces; her turn should come.

2:47.race_name: Glyn Hall Wealth Management Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race) (Div I)
2:47.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Aneedahbeer
runners.comment: 15,000gns breeze-up 2yo; 11th foal; Kodi Bear half-brother to four winners, one useful
runners.spotlight: £10,000 yearling, 15,000gns breeze-up 2yo; 11th foal; Kodi Bear half-brother to four winners including Gorgeous Noora (5f/6f including 2yo/AW Listed; RPR 103), Washraa (7f AW/1m turf; 90) and Hawridge Storm (1m2f; 83); dam 1m 2yo winner (101), sister to 5f Group 2 winner Muthmir; worth a second look.

runners.name: Beyond The Dream
runners.comment: 100-1, slowest into stride and always behind when beaten 18l at Windsor (6f, good to firm)
runners.spotlight: 100-1, slowest into stride and always behind when beaten 18l at Windsor (6f, good to firm) 15 days ago, 12l behind Eyes Front.

runners.name: Eyes Front
runners.comment: 66-1, slowly away when 10th of 12 at Windsor (6f, good to firm) but form is as good as any
runners.spotlight: Late foal; 66-1, slowly away and green when tenth of 12 in maiden at Windsor (6f, good to firm) 15 days ago, but beaten about only 6l and that form is as good as any in this field.

runners.name: Galileo Island
runners.comment: 10-1, blew the start when eighth of 11 in Newmarket novice (6f, good) 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: 10-1, blew the start when eighth of 11 in Newmarket novice (6f, good) 18 days ago, never in the main group but bred for further than that.

runners.name: Lamnol
runners.comment: 40-1, never close enough or going well enough here (5f, good); now 7f, gelded and hooded
runners.spotlight: 40-1, never close enough or going well enough in maiden here (5f, good) in late April, beaten just over 8l; now gelded and hooded; also goes over an extra 2f which should suit.

runners.name: Magnatura
runners.comment: 10,000gns foal; eighth foal; half-brother to five winners, three useful
runners.spotlight: 10,000gns foal; eighth foal; half-brother to five winners including Vernet (7f including 2yo; RPR 100), Arthur's Realm (1m-1m2f; 97) and Marunouchi (1m2f; 93); dam unraced half-sister to 1m Listed winner Athanor, out of US 1m2f Grade 1 winner; gelded son of Magna Grecia; market can guide.

runners.name: Project Incheon
runners.comment: 14-1 third of ten at Redcar (6f, good to firm) 15 days ago, always prominent and rallying
runners.spotlight: £1,000 yearling by Zoustar; dam 1m AW winner (RPR 74); 14-1 from 10-1 when just over 3l third of ten in maiden at Redcar (6f, good to firm) 15 days ago, always prominent and rallying; that's easily the most competitive display produced by this field.

runners.name: Runswick
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling by Ghaiyyath; first foal; dam 1m winner (RPR 77); needs a close look
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling by Ghaiyyath; first foal; dam 1m winner (RPR 77), sister to 1m2f winner Liberty Coach, out of 1m4f-winning half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Integral; 2yo debut winners from this yard are rare but he needs a close look against probably limited opposition.

runners.name: Telling Time
runners.comment: 200-1, tailed off at Newbury (6f, good); bred more for this trip; major drop in class
runners.spotlight: 200-1, faded to be tailed off in maiden at Newbury (6f, good) 18 days ago; bred more for this trip and this is a major drop in class.

runners.name: Torbay
runners.comment: Got loose before intended debut; 66-1 when last of ten at Windsor (6f, good) 11 days later
runners.spotlight: Got loose and bolted before intended debut; 66-1 when last of ten in maiden at Windsor (6f, good) 11 days later, beaten 20l.

runners.name: Amberia
runners.comment: 2,000euros yearling by Coulsty; 7th foal; half-sister to four winners; needs a second look
runners.spotlight: 2,000euros yearling by Coulsty; seventh foal; half-sister to four winners, including Chestnutter (7f/7.4f; RPR 81), Torno Subito (UAE 1m dirt) and Tout Relatif (Italian 6f 2yo/5.5f); dam unraced half-sister to BC Juvenile Turf winner Outstrip, out of US 1m1f Grade 1 winner; needs a second look.

2:17.race_name: Sophie Ellis-Bextor Live @leicesterraces 5th July Apprentice Handicap
2:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Emily Rebecca
runners.comment: Second over 1m2f in her first two handicaps, before a lesser show in blinkers over 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Second over 1m2f at Lingfield (AW) and Brighton (good to firm) in her first two handicaps, before a lesser show when never dangerous in blinkers over 1m4f at Chepstow; that experiment is abandoned on both fronts and she's in serious calculations for this apparently weak race.

runners.name: Respiro Solitario
runners.comment: In frame in the last four of his five handicaps; hung left when below form at 1m2f latest
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in the last four of his five handicaps, last time when upped to 1m2f (plenty of stamina in the family) on firm ground at Bath, but that was a dip in form and he hung left in the closing stages.

runners.name: Grande Armee
runners.owner: All For One Racing Vi And Partner
runners.comment: No solid form in her qualifying races (1m, AW) but it's easy to think that 1m2f+ will suit
runners.spotlight: No solid form in her three qualifying races over 1m on AW but it's easy to think that 1m2f+ will suit now that she goes handicapping.

runners.name: Split Silk
runners.owner: R Barnett And Mrs B V Sangster
runners.comment: Whiff of ability last autumn; beat one home in each of two handicaps (7f/1m2f) this spring
runners.spotlight: There was a whiff of ability last autumn but she's beaten only one home in each of her two handicaps (7f/1m2f) this spring; down in class.

runners.name: Dance No More
runners.comment: Best form debut; 40-1 for handicap/turf debut at Haydock (1m2f, good to firm) 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 3l when fifth of seven on debut at Southwell (1m, AW) in March but low-level form in her three starts since, the latest when 40-1 for handicap/turf debut at Haydock (1m2f, good to firm) 11 days ago; late foal and 7lb claimer is enlisted.

runners.name: Ottoman
runners.comment: 0-10; upped to 1m2f when third at Bath (firm; Respiro Solitario fourth) on latest outing
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Ireland last year; made the frame in two of his three British handicaps for new connections, upped to 1m2f when third of ten at Bath (firm; Respiro Solitario fourth) on latest outing; that proved his stamina and, having hung left, cheekpieces are now given a go.

runners.name: Shabu Shabu
runners.comment: Bred far more for this trip and further; off ten weeks (gelded) and cheekpieces go on
runners.spotlight: Best of his three qualifying races was second start (1m, AW); never remotely near the leaders that day but he's bred far more for this trip and further; off ten weeks (gelded) since latest start and cheekpieces go on; 7lb claimer too; could be posed to find improvement on handicap debut.

runners.name: Abstract Art
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden; latest start was first in 127 days; could build on that on return to turf
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; all seven of his handicaps were on AW, in the shake-up in three (Wolverhampton 8.6f/9.4f); below form on sole attempt at 1m4f but worth a go at 1m2f and latest start was his first in 127 days; could build on that on today's return to turf.

runners.name: Helaali
runners.comment: Modest maiden (eight races) who has not shone in handicaps; upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden (eight races) who has not shone in handicaps; pedigree suggests she is not shouting out for this step up in trip but latest performance gave a bit of encouragement for it.

runners.name: Aurelius Maximus
runners.comment: Easily closest finish latest (1m2f handicap) but needs a good deal better; 5lb claimer now
runners.spotlight: It was his second handicap when beaten about 5l in first-time blinkers at Brighton (1m2f, good to firm) latest, easily his closest finish but fading into fifth of nine and he needs a good deal better; 5lb claimer now.

runners.name: Cuda Been A Rowlex
runners.comment: Won at Redcar (1m2f, good) in April; well below form on both starts since; cheekpieces now
runners.spotlight: Ninth start when opening his account off 1lb lower at Redcar (1m2f, good) in April, always prominent; well below form on both starts since (1m/1m2f) and cheekpieces are now given a go.

runners.name: Hot Shot Lawyer
runners.comment: Couldn't be any lower for this opening mark and some ability is probably lurking
runners.spotlight: Late foal; beaten progressively further at big prices in each of his 1m maidens, albeit setting a good pace to over 2f out at Goodwood last time (still looked green); bred to stay 1m2f; he couldn't be any lower for his opening mark and, with some ability probably lurking, needs a second look.

runners.name: Leading Star Girl
runners.comment: Hasn't really threatened in any of her nine races, in handicaps (7f-1m4f) for the last six
runners.spotlight: Hasn't really threatened in any of her nine races, in handicaps over 7f-1m4f for the last six; wore cheekpieces on last two outings.

3:47.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Azucena
runners.comment: 0-11 on turf but beaten about only 2l in handicap latest run; hooded once, now cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Almost two years between her two wins, the latter at Newcastle (5f, AW) last October; 0-11 on turf but beaten about only 2l in a Catterick handicap (5f, good to firm) latest outing; hooded once (2023) and now tries cheekpieces.

runners.name: Battleofbaltimore

prev_owners.owner: Catch Us If You Can Racing & Dylan Cunha
Catch Us If You Can Racing Cunha Nel
Catch Us If You Can Racing

runners.comment: Some 2024 runs make him of interest, but last month's reappearance less so for new yard
runners.spotlight: Sole win (21 races) was at Yarmouth in a 5f classified event on good to firm last July; two thirds subsequently for Dylan Cunha last season also make him of interest, but last month's reappearance less so for new yard.

runners.name: Dunnington Lad

prev_owners.owner: Chris Kiely Racing Ltd & J Stokes

runners.comment: Two 5f handicap wins from front at Ripon last summer; 2025 has been a lot less convincing
runners.spotlight: Added two 5f handicap wins from the front at Ripon (on soft and good) last summer but 2025 performances have been a lot less convincing.

runners.name: Ifonlytheycudtalk
runners.comment: Win and placed form in 2024; threatened something similar only once (second run) this term
runners.spotlight: Only one win from 22 starts, in a Beverley handicap last September; placed five other times last season but he's threatened something similar only once (second start) this term.

runners.name: Irish Dancer
runners.comment: Won on penultimate start; he's one of the most likely to give his running in this field
runners.spotlight: Last month's breakthrough success came at the 18th attempt but he ran respectably in another Catterick 5f handicap ten days ago, confirming that he's one of the most likely to give his running in this field; tongue tied for those last two outings; player.

runners.name: Korroor
runners.comment: Both wins have been on Newcastle AW, 6f in March on latest start; 5f on turf is worth a go
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been on Newcastle AW, including when a first-time visor replaced cheekpieces in March (6f; hung left) on latest start; unraced over shorter than that but it now looks worth a go; only four runs on turf but latest (here last June) showed ability; major chance if all is well after the break.

runners.name: Malham Tarn Cove
runners.comment: Pieces of form last term (one win) to take seriously; may have needed recent reappearance
runners.spotlight: One win (Bath handicap in May 2024) from 21 races but he had other form last term to be taken seriously and may have needed his recent reappearance; each-way chance.

runners.name: Timebar
runners.comment: 0-13; having tried 1m on last two outings, he now goes shorter than 6f for the first time
runners.spotlight: Has some ability but first win is still proving elusive (13 races) and, having tried 1m on last two outings, he now goes shorter than 6f for the first time; many equipment changes this year, today's including the removal of the tongue-tie he's worn on last five outings.

runners.name: War Zone
runners.comment: Two 5f Chelmsford wins; has bounced back before; turf debut may ask the biggest question
runners.spotlight: He'd been threatening to win and did so at Chelmsford (5f, AW) in October and February; form dipped there on latest outing but he has bounced back before; making turf debut may ask the biggest question.

runners.name: Fregola
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden who does not present convincing claims; first run in a classified race
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who does not present convincing claims despite now making her first appearance in a classified race.

runners.name: Pastoral Way
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden; Carlisle four days ago suggested return to 5f is in order; e-w claims
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who's sported headgear in 6f handicaps on last two outings; Carlisle four days ago suggested that this return to 5f is in order; each-way claims.

3:17.race_name: Glyn Hall Wealth Management Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race) (Div II)
3:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.9) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Eschweiler
runners.comment: 1,000euros yearling by Alkumait; 2yo wins for the stable are rare
runners.spotlight: 1,000euros yearling; seventh foal; Alkumait half-brother to three winners, including Danehill Quest (1m; RPR 63) and Kundalini (Italian 1m-9.5f including 2yo); dam placed at 10.5f-12.5f in France; 2yo wins for the stable are rare.

runners.name: Explosion
runners.comment: 6,000gns yearling; powerful yard's first 2yo winner this term was a newcomer on Sunday
runners.spotlight: 6,000gns yearling; fourth foal; Showcasing half-brother to KSA 1m2f winner Thundersquall; dam 7f-1m4f winner (including 2yo, Irish 1,000 Guineas and Yorkshire Oaks; RPR 116); powerful yard's first 2yo winner this term was a newcomer on Sunday.

runners.name: Grand Echo
runners.comment: 100-1 for newcomers race at Newbury (5f, good), always towards rear but some ability
runners.spotlight: 100-1 for newcomers race at Newbury (5f, good) six weeks ago, always towards rear but showing some ability in going down by 6l; should improve.

runners.name: Jack The Tooth
runners.comment: 25-1, about 4l eighth of 12 at Windsor (6f, good to firm) with promise from towards rear
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when eighth of 12 in maiden at Windsor (6f, good to firm) 15 days ago, with promise from towards rear and beaten about only 4l; should improve and appeals most of those who have raced, but that's only two of them.

runners.name: Parole Officer
runners.comment: 11,000gns yearling by Without Parole; early stage for yard's 2yos but worth a market check
runners.spotlight: 9,000gns foal, 11,000gns yearling by Without Parole; second foal; dam once-raced out of unraced half-sister to Racing Post Trophy/St Leger winner Brian Boru, 1m4f Group 2 winner Sea Moon and 12.5f Group 2 winner Moon Search; early stage for the yard's 2yos but worth a market check.

runners.name: Penhallam
runners.comment: 16,000gns foal; yard's two 2yo wins last month (from six runs) were both second time out
runners.spotlight: 16,000gns foal; third foal; Time Test half-brother to 5.7f winner Pollinate (RPR 55); dam 5f/6f winner (including Listed; 101), sister to 6f winner Twilight Spirit, half-sister to 6f Group 1 winner Twilight Son; his trainer's two 2yo wins last month (from six runs) were both second time out.

runners.name: Sovereign Lord
runners.comment: 16,000euros yearling; late foal; needs close look; yard has had 2yo newcomer win this year
runners.spotlight: 16,000euros yearling; third foal; Supremacy half-brother to 6f AW winner Bruce Lightning (RPR 75); dam unplaced at 5f-9.5f (58), half-sister to winners Beau Recall (US 1m/8.5f Grade 2) and Coolminx (Listed-placed 5f-7f including 2yo), out of useful 8.6f-1m4f winner; late foal; needs a close look and trainer has had 2yo newcomer win this year.

runners.name: Takeitorleaveit
runners.comment: 8,000gns yearling by Ubettabelieveit; yard without 2yo win at early stage of this season
runners.spotlight: 8,000gns yearling by Ubettabelieveit; seventh foal; closely related to 7.5f-12.4f winner City Wanderer (RPR 83), half-brother to winners Dawn View (1m-1m2f; 65), Villemacho (French 8.5f AW) and Bohemian Rhapsody (Czech 1m 2yo); dam German 7f/7.5f (Listed) 2yo winner (95); yard without a 2yo win at this early stage of this season.

runners.name: Woody Y Fernandez
runners.comment: 8,500gns foal by Lope Y Fernandez; trainer without 2yo win in recent seasons (few runners)
runners.spotlight: 8,500gns foal by Lope Y Fernandez; first foal; dam once-raced half-sister to French 1m3f Listed winner, out of maiden half-sister to 1m2f Group 1 winner Shalanaya; trainer's few 2yo runs in recent seasons do not include a win.

runners.name: Creciente
runners.comment: 6,000gns yearling; yard's sole 2yo winner this term (filly) is 3-3, Listed win last week
runners.spotlight: 6,000gns yearling by Lope Y Fernandez; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to 8.6f 2yo winner Beau Nash, out of Group-placed 7f 2yo winner; the stable's only 2yo winner this term (filly) is 3-3, with Listed win last week.

7:45.race_name: Highbet Traders Treble Odds Boost Handicap
7:45.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; Turf course: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Sugar Hill Babe
runners.comment: Progressive mare; career best at Nottingham latest; 6lb rise demands further improvement
runners.spotlight: Progressed in the second half of 2024 and she's carried on the good work this spring, second at Nottingham in April and easily seeing off her six rivals back at that track 24 days ago; a 6lb rise back against males asks a stiffer question.

runners.name: Tourist
runners.comment: Impressive at Bath on stable debut; less good on AW since but returning to turf is a plus
runners.spotlight: Well backed when making a winning stable debut at Bath in April (5f, good to firm); only midfield at Southwell five weeks ago but returning to turf can help and the Bath win did promise better.

runners.name: Glamorous Breeze
runners.comment: Fresh not usually the time to catch her, so last month's Chepstow success bodes well
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with two good runs; ready win at Chepstow on her seasonal return 13 days ago bodes well given she's usually needed a run or two; still has handicapping scope up 4lb; drawn widest but seriously considered.

quotes.race: S H Jones Wines Handicap
quotes.quote: Glamorous Breeze is just quirky. She's got plenty of ability and was second in a Listed race last season. This year I figured her out, sit, hold still then [go] last 50 yards. It's not she's ungenuine, she just does enough - William Cox, jockey.

runners.name: Master Of My Fate
runners.owner: Ms Janelle Cao, Ross Harmon & Partner
runners.comment: Two creditable Thirsk runs last month but perhaps still a shade high in the weights
runners.spotlight: Had a fine winter on AW, the latest of his four wins coming in January off 2lb lower; both turf runs at Thirsk last month were respectable but he will need a return to his absolute best to take this.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Master Of My Fate jumped really well and the more he's racing the more he's improving. I'd like to think when he gets back on turf he will do the same - Jason Hart, jockey.

quotes.race: Trevor Woods Memorial British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C & D) Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Master Of My Fate been training well at home. I'm very pleased with how he did it. You can only beat what's put in front of you, but we've always liked him and I was delighted to see him win - John Quinn, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He beat very little when winning at Pontefract on his debut but he beat them very well and also ran well in a novice at Lingfield, even though he wasn't in love with that track. Then it didn't look like he stayed 6f at Newcastle. I'd imagine we'll drop him back to 5f and he could be one for decent sprint handicaps. He's been gelded and I think that will help him. 20-03-24

runners.name: One Night Stand
runners.comment: Nearly four years since his last turf win; others bring more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Getting on for four years since his last win on turf; he's feasibly treated on this winter's AW best but others bring more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: One Night Stand is a horse who, when you get him to the front, can get a breather from the three to the two and slingshot off the bend, and I probably nicked it there - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

runners.name: Kiss And Run
runners.comment: Back to last winning mark and two runs this year should have her spot on; contender
runners.spotlight: She hasn't found her best form in her two starts this year but should be at peak fitness now and she has slipped back to her last winning mark; stable had a winner here on Saturday night and she's one to consider.

8:15.race_name: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap
8:15.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; Turf course: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Skellig Isle
runners.comment: Sharper for last month's return and well drawn to bag the stands' rail; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; won 5f fillies' maiden at Nottingham last summer on fast ground; in and out in handicaps but she may have needed last month's return and she's well drawn to bag the stands' rail this time; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: She was a bucking bronco first time out at Sandown but then ran a really good race to be fourth at Kempton. She goes to Nottingham for a 5f maiden on Thursday and Tom is convinced she's a nice filly. He did a great job for us with Roman Mist a couple of years ago. 02-08-24

runners.name: Pouting
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.comment: 0-8 but consistent and more realistically weighted now; one to be interested in
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in eight starts and beaten at short odds on her last two; has shown clear winning potential though and she's one to be interested in back in handicap company.

runners.name: Sandscreendeliverd
runners.comment: Best run when 2nd to Ghostman over C&D last month; good draw and still unexposed
runners.spotlight: Unexposed sprinter who ran his best race when keeping on well for second behind Ghostman over C&D two weeks ago; drawn near the stands' rail again and he's a contender despite a 2lb rise.

runners.name: Solar Edge
runners.comment: Two wins as a 2yo; career best when second on AW latest; higher draw preferable
runners.spotlight: Won two Class 6 nurseries as a 2yo; slow start to 2025 but his latest front-running second at Wolverhampton was much more like it; higher draw would have been preferred but he may yet do better.

runners.name: Ghostman
runners.comment: Off the mark with a narrow C&D win two weeks ago; not so favourably drawn today though
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the tenth attempt when beating Sandscreendeliverd by a neck over C&D two weeks ago; unexposed in sprint handicaps on turf and a 3lb rise doesn't look excessive; stall 1 not ideal given the stands' rail was such an advantage here on Saturday night.

runners.name: Bretton Wood
runners.comment: Didn't progress for James Owen last season; sold for 13,000gns in September; check betting
runners.spotlight: Didn't build on his early promise for James Owen last season; sold for 13,000gns last September; useful draw for this reappearance and it will be interesting to see how he goes in the betting.

runners.name: Another Abbot
runners.comment: Only just missed out behind in-form opponent at Redcar latest; low mileage; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite on his handicap debut at Yarmouth last month but he took a good step forward when second of eight, beaten a head, at Redcar last week; the latter field finished in a heap but the winner was an in-form and well-handicapped sprinter and the form looks solid; open to further progress and he holds strong claims off the same mark.

runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.comment: Generally struggled in handicaps, including in Ghostman's race over C&D two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Promising early 2yo but she's generally struggled since handicapping; dropped away to finish last of eight behind Ghostman over C&D two weeks ago and others look safer.

stable_tour.quote: She was super impressive first time out at Wolverhampton. I was kicking myself after Bath as I shouldn't have run her there with a penalty and the track probably didn't suit her. The form of that race is unbelievable, though, as the winner [Betty Clover] has gone on to win the Marygate and the second [Englemere] has won twice since quite comfortably. She's a very honest filly who tries very hard, and just tries to do a little too much in the first half of a race. She was very good when second in the Lily Agnes as it looked a nice race. She's owned by a local guy from Wrexham, so she'll probably be campaigned around Chester and she looks tailormade for it. Six furlongs won't be a problem and there'll be plenty more days for her. The more experience she gets, the more she'll be able to mix it on different tracks. She could be one for the St Hugh Stakes at Newbury later on and she looks capable of picking up black type. 30-05-24

7:15.race_name: Highbet Acca Odds Boost / EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
7:15.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; Turf course: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Balthamos
runners.comment: 150,000gns yearling; brother to 2yo Group 2 winner Berkshire Shadow; likely type on paper
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns yearling by Dark Angel; fourth foal; brother to 5f-1m winner Berkshire Shadow (including 2yo Group 2; RPR 116); dam 7f/1m winner (RPR 99), sister to 10.3f winner Canonbury, half-sister to 1m-1m4f winner Bohemian Dance; lots to like on paper.

runners.name: Beckfords Folly
runners.comment: Out of a French 6.5f-1m1f winner (including Group 3); hooded on debut for powerful yard
runners.spotlight: Second foal; by Lope De Vega out of a French 6.5f-1m1f winner (including Group 3; RPR 105), half-sister to winners Miss Havre (1m2f) and Blondynka Mnm (German 1m), out of unraced close relative of champion 2yo Teofilo; hooded on debut for his powerful stable.

runners.name: Lohoobb
runners.comment: Pulled hard when down the field on debut at Newbury; needs to take a big step forward.
runners.spotlight: Closely related to multiple 1m winner Maamora (including Group 3; RPR 107); pulled hard when down the field on debut at Newbury (6f, good; 18-1) and needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: Paranjape
runners.owner: G H Thompson &  S P C Woods
runners.comment: Dam 7f AW winner, half-sister to Listed winner Caernafon; watch the market on debut
runners.spotlight: Second foal; by Ardad out of a 7f AW winner (RPR 66), half-sister to winners Caernarfon (7f/1m including 2yo/Listed; third in Oaks) and Dans Dream (7f Group 3); watch the betting on debut.

runners.name: Shaatir
runners.comment: Showed plenty when third of eight on debut at Chepstow 13 days ago; holds strong claims
runners.spotlight: 130,000euros foal and 210,000gns yearling; showed plenty when third of eight on debut at Chepstow (6f, good; 3-1) 13 days ago; ought to have benefited from that experience and holds strong claims.

runners.name: Daretobedifferent
runners.comment: Beaten 3l when keeping on to finish third of six in fillies' novice on debut; can improve
runners.spotlight: 22,000gns yearling; half-sister to five winners including Galinea (French 6.5f-1m 2yo; RPR 92); briefly outpaced and kept on to finish third of six, beaten 3l, behind a stablemate of Beckford's Folly in a fillies' novice on debut at Newmarket (6f, good to firm) 17 days ago; likely to improve.

8:45.race_name: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap
8:45.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; Turf course: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering)

runners.name: Me Tarzan
runners.comment: Bolted up tried in a visor at Leicester last week; well in under penalty; obvious claims
runners.spotlight: He had been running well enough in handicaps on turf and AW but the application of a visor transformed him at Leicester last week (7f, good to soft) as he tanked through the race and won by the thick end of 4l; looks well in under a penalty and he's been found another weak race.

runners.name: Up The Anti
runners.comment: Not beaten far over 6f at Wolverhampton latest; stamina query but drawn nearest the rail
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far at Wolverhampton 12 days ago and she's been dropped another 2lb since; has to prove herself over 7f but she is drawn nearest the rail and could yet have a bigger run in her.

runners.name: Latona
runners.comment: Not beaten far in her four handicap runs this year; might find one or two stronger
runners.spotlight: She hasn't been beaten far in four handicap runs this year, the latest when fifth of eight at Brighton two weeks ago (7f, good); might find a couple too strong once again.

runners.name: Blackbrook
runners.comment: Dropped away in two 1m handicaps this year (too free when backed on Monday); risky for now
runners.spotlight: Faded into midfield on his handicap debut at Windsor five weeks ago (1m, good to firm); well backed at Brighton yesterday but again dropped right away having raced too freely early on; clearly felt capable of better but not a solid option.

runners.name: My Boy Harry
runners.comment: Penultimate run was encouraging and caught wider than ideal last time; may yet do better
runners.spotlight: Penultimate effort at Chelmsford wasn't too bad and he got caught wider than ideal back at that track last month; needs improvement to win but it's not out of the question.

runners.name: Campani
runners.comment: Poor form in three 2yo runs but looks a likely improver now handicapping; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three AW runs in second half of 2024; gelded prior to this handicap debut and bred to be better than this level; market instructive.

runners.name: Straighttothepoint
runners.comment: Poor form for new yard and tailed off behind Me Tarzan last week; now gets blinkers
runners.spotlight: Landed a 5.5f claimer in France last September but there's nothing for new stable to suggest she is the answer today; 50-1 when tailed off behind Me Tarzan at Leicester last week; now gets blinkers.

runners.name: Galette
runners.breeder: Mrs D Joly, D Powell & A Richardson
runners.comment: Exposed 12-race maiden; finished 12l behind the reopposing Me Tarzan last week
runners.spotlight: Exposed 12-race maiden; not at her best in 2025 and finished 12l behind the reopposing Me Tarzan at Leicester last week.

runners.name: Solanna
runners.comment: Course winner; runner-up the last twice and looks likely to give his running once again
runners.spotlight: Course winner who won at Chelmsford in February over 1m2f off 3lb lower; runner-up on his last two starts, latest when beaten a neck at Kempton (AW) over this trip 57 days ago; unexposed over 1m4f and looks likely to give his running.

stable_tour.quote: He got the season off to a fantastic start by winning three races on the bounce, which saw his rating shoot up from 47 to 68. I then made the mistake of giving him time off to strengthen up and I haven't been happy with his last three runs. I expected a big show at Wolverhampton last time but he was mid-division. I've been happy with him at home of late and I think you'll see a different horse next time. 23-09-22

runners.name: Sharp Distinction
runners.comment: Won over C&D off 1lb lower; ran respectably in January when last seen; headgear removed
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in November when sporting first-time blinkers off 1lb lower, doing well to come from off the pace, before being well beaten over hurdles and back here over 2m; ran respectably at Southwell (1m4f, AW) in January when last seen; now has the headgear removed and holds claims.

runners.name: Meleri
runners.comment: Finished runner-up here over 1m2f on her reappearance run; steps back up in trip; claims
runners.spotlight: Turf winner in 2022 and 2023; beaten 2l when runner-up here over 1m2f last time on her first start for 219 days and now steps back up in trip with solid claims.

runners.name: Major Reward
runners.comment: Last of five at Kempton on his return from three years off; big step forward needed
runners.spotlight: Won on AW at Dundalk in 2018 and 2019; beaten about 30l in two starts over hurdles for this yard in 2022 and finished last of five back on the Flat at Kempton (1m3f) on his first start for over three years; drops in grade but needs to take a big step forward from that reappearance.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Major Reward is a genuine horse and he tries hard. I got a nice pocket in by the rail and he travelled well into the straight. He can be a funny horse but today was his day - John Shinnick, rider.

runners.name: Artavian
runners.owner: G E Bassett & P R Chamings
runners.comment: Won on heavy ground in October; weakened late at Wolverhampton on return; up in grade
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on heavy ground at Windsor in October over 11.5f; didn't look the easiest of rides on his return at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) 35 days ago but he weakened into third only late on; steps up in grade but he may come on for that outing.

runners.name: Mr Nugget
runners.comment: Won at Southwell in February but he was beaten 36l on turf last time; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Opened his account off 2lb lower at Southwell over 1m3f in February but he failed to build on that in his next two starts and was beaten 36l on turf at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to firm) 12 days ago; needs to bounce back returned to AW.

runners.name: Ectocross
runners.comment: Three wins in 2023; well beaten in four starts since being gelded; steps back up to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Won three times in 2023, including here over 1m2f, but he's not been in the same form in four starts since being gelded; possibly needed the outing over 1m at Kempton last time and now steps back up to 1m4f, which should suit, with better needed.

runners.name: Tatmeen
runners.comment: Improved when upped to this trip to win at Kempton last time; major contender up 5lb
runners.spotlight: Didn't go unbacked when beaten a neck here over 1m on handicap debut in April and improved again when upped to this trip at Kempton (beat 11 rivals under Jack Dace) last time, running on strongly from off the pace having been held up from a wide draw; major contender up 5lb.

6:45.race_name: Highbet Weekly Racing Rewards Club Classified Stakes

runners.name: Aeroplane Mode
runners.comment: 0-15; disappointed in both starts since finishing third here over 1m2f in March; hood off
runners.spotlight: Third of 12 in a classified event at this track over 1m2f in March but he's disappointed in two starts in handicaps since and is now 0-15; steps up in trip with the hood now removed; return to 0-50 classified company can help.

runners.name: Certain Style
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Allowed huge advantage when winning here in November; yet to build on that; down in grade
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 16th attempt when allowed to poach a huge advantage in a 2m handicap here in November but she was well beaten off the same mark next time and was reported to have hung right when fourth of seven over C&D 41 days ago; down in grade.

quotes.race: Stay In Control With BetUK "Hands And Heels" Apprentice Handicap (Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I said to Tyrese if there was no pace to let Certain Style bowl along, but it was pretty diabolical from the riders in behind - Ian Mongan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Drouthy Neebor
runners.comment: 0-10; in good form prior to pulling up after his saddle slipped last time; respected
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but he was placed in five handicaps (1m2f-1m6f) before being pulled up at Wolverhampton 15 days ago after his saddle slipped; that's worth forgiving and the drop back to 1m4f should be fine; respected on his first go in a classified event.

runners.name: Fen Tiger
runners.comment: Three-time winner on turf in 2022; beaten 29l on his reappearance in March; down in grade
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner on turf in 2022 but he has been placed here over 2m; beaten 29l on his return at Southwell (1m4f, AW) 74 days ago and now drops into classified company; others preferred.

quotes.race: AJA Novice Flat Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Fen Tiger loved it out there and stayed all day up the hill. The ground was quite soft and ideal for him - Freddie Gordon, jockey.

runners.name: Foinix
runners.comment: Won two classified events last August; raced too freely on turf last time; claims.
runners.spotlight: Won two classified events last August, with the second of those coming here on the turf track; third behind an easy winner at Chelmsford (1m6f, AW; Drouthy Neebor second) last month and raced too freely at Brighton (1m4f, good to firm) 26 days ago; back on AW and holds claims returned to a classified.

quotes.race: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Looking back at his form Foinix is well capable of having a sudden change in fortunes. He feels like he's really enjoying his racing. At Brighton he didn't look like a classified horse and didn't do so again today. He can just be a little bit gassy but he gets into a beautiful rhythm. He's definitely worth a go at further trips, but keep him where he is for now because he's doing nothing wrong - Joe Leavy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Fullforward
runners.comment: 2 lesser runs have followed his 3rd over C&D in March, but down in grade with place claims
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been on turf but he's been in the first three in eight of his 17 AW starts; third of nine in a handicap over C&D in March; two lesser efforts have followed but he probably didn't stay 1m6f on turf at Salisbury last time; down in trip/grade and has place claims.

runners.name: Guns And Flowers
runners.comment: Sole win came over 6f in 2023; well beaten last time and she has stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 15 starts came in a 6f maiden at Chelmsford when trained by Alice Haynes in 2023; beaten 18l when last of six here last time (1m) and steps up in distance with her stamina to prove; cheekpieces removed.

runners.name: Prince Hector
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Prince Hector, he's taken a bit of getting to know but hopefully we can now keep his head in front - Jessica Bedi, trainer.

runners.name: Regal Glory
runners.comment: 1-26; ran one of her better recent races last time but did hang right; stamina is a doubt.
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 26 starts came here in December 2022; ran one of her better recent races when third of 11 at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm; hung right) 15 days ago and return to AW looks fine, but this extra 2f is an unknown.

runners.name: Sapphire Sirocco
runners.comment: Hasn't been able to get involved from off the pace over C&D the last twice; could go well
runners.spotlight: 0-7 and she hasn't been able to get involved from off the pace in steadily run classified events over C&D the last twice; off since seventh of 12 in March, slowly into stride; needs things to drop right but could go well.

runners.name: Uther Pendragon
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore

runners.comment: Well beaten on return but he didn't run badly when last seen in classified company

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky at Bath last time when he got turned sideways. At least with Fact Or Fable you can semi-predict whenever he's going to win but old Uther is more unpredictable. He won three times in a week just before he turned eight. He's versatile at any trip from a mile and a quarter to two and a quarter miles. He enjoys it and pays his way every year, which is nice. I wouldn't mind a few more horses like him. I raced him in France a fair bit as a two- and three-year-old and he had won €98,000 in prize-money and was still a maiden. 04-07-24

runners.spotlight: Beaten 42l and 20l in his two starts since being gelded, most recently on handicap debut at Salisbury (1m4f, good to firm) 19 days ago; drops into classified company and returns to AW.

stable_tour.quote: He's a well-bred gelding who goes back to Golden Horn on the dam's side of his pedigree. He was previously owned by Clipper Logistics but Julie Camacho loved him and asked us to buy him for her to continue training him. He had his first run on turf at Haydock last week but didn't get a clear run and ended up seventh of ten behind Sedgemoor. Hopefully he'll have a big three-year-old campaign. 14-06-24

runners.name: Bill Plumb

runners.spotlight: Two of his three wins have come over C&D and has finished runner-up in two of his last three starts at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) since the tongue-tie went on; back up 2lb but still holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Bowman
runners.comment: Has become hard to win with and the switch to this stable hasn't halted the decline

quotes.race: Cazoo Derby Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: I wanted to get a breather in going down to the road and from there we just stepped up while trying to save a bit for the end. I thought it was a good run and Bowman likes to make the running, but you have to get going on him before they start challenging him as then he can battle back. He had good bits of form before they got him and he ran well last time, so he was not without a chance - William Carson, rider.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Novice Auction Stakes

quotes.race: Follow @AtTheRaces On Twitter Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was an opportunity we couldn't resist as we've got 20,000GBP for it being a Great British Bonus race. I'd love to aim Value Added at a fillies' handicap at Goodwood over a mile and a quarter as the race looks like it'll suit her - Richard Hughes, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She had some respectable form on the Flat for Richard Hughes - she was rated in the 80s - and appears an ideal type for juvenile hurdling. 15-11-23

This is the second of the two horses I train for the King and Queen and she is a lovely filly. On her sole run last year she was second at Newbury, only beaten a neck after which we put her away for the winter. She wintered nicely but I was in no hurry to get her out as she had a few issues in the spring so we gave her all the time she needed. She was meant to return at Windsor but broke out of the gate, which was very frustrating. Her comeback run was at Newbury where she ran well enough to be fifth of 13. She has come out of the race well and is likely to have her first run on the all-weather next at Wolverhampton over 1m1f. 29-06-23

runners.name: Valkyrja

I think ten furlongs is his trip but he will get more adaptable to middle-distances as he goes along. He should progress and improve again - Jamie Spencer, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice colt who ran a good race behind Fancy Man in the Listed Ascendant Stakes at Haydock in September. He is set to run at Newbury (3.25) on Friday. She did everything right, but it was only the last half-furlong I thought I'd win. I'm sure she'd get a mile, although I'd be happy to see her over seven next time - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

3:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Bective Abbey

runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and has mixed record over hurdles since winning Irish point debut in January 2023; scored on handicap debut at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft; first run after wind surgery) in April and will be fine on the quicker surface; very unexposed at about 3m and switches to chasing with significant potential.

stable_tour.quote: He won a point-to-point and then in a novice hurdle at Warwick in April. He's made for chasing and, even though he's had only two runs over hurdles, it won't be long before he switches to fences. 22-10-24

runners.spotlight: Bounced back from two poor performances to win in first-time visor at Worcester (2m7f, good) last month and is now 2-6 over fences; 6lb higher here but can make his presence felt if the new headgear continues to have a positive effect.

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was really disappointed with Montregard at Newcastle but I think the cheekpieces have helped him here and he's toughed it out well - Tom Lacey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse of JP McManus's who won his maiden at the second attempt over hurdles when last seen at Warwick in April. I was really pleased with him that day; he was green but toughed it out and stayed on nicely. I'd say he's progressed through the summer and is set to return in a 0-105 handicap hurdle at Uttoxeter on Friday. He'll ultimately jump a fence too. A nice prospect. 20-12-23

runners.name: Jimmy The Digger
runners.comment: Kept on well for second in a hunter chase in April but this 12yo is inconsistent nowadays

quotes.race: Andrew Malam Lifetime In Racing Award Winner Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I was astonished this morning when I saw Jimmy The Digger was 20-1 and then he was backed into 9-1 or whatever, but it was nothing to do with me. We'll go for a similar race next time - he's quite a fun handicap chaser. I don't think he's ground-dependent - Henry Daly, trainer.

quotes.race: Tanners Claret Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Jimmy The Digger is a lovely, big brute of a horse and he's just kept galloping. He jumps well but we might just run in another bumper with a penalty - Henry Daly, trainer.

runners.name: Do No Wrong

runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner, including in this race in 2024; returned from 201-day absence with comfortable open point win last month and is evidently in good nick; might be the answer.

runners.comment: Pulled up at Fakenham last month but has pretty good record at this track
