quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ali Star Bert likes to make the jockeys work, but he knows Southwell inside out. I bred him and am so pleased with how he's turned out. He's slow, but always keeps trying hard, and those types aren't easy to find. The last two furlongs made all the difference, as turning in I thought he was going to be second or third at best - Shaun Harris, trainer.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shaun (Harris, trainer) wasn't sure about the ground as he'd never run on it before but maybe that's what Ali Star Bert wanted. That's my fifth winner this season which is already better than last season when I broke my leg and was off for a good while - Hugh Nugent, jockey.

2:30.race_name: RCA Summer Jumps Championship Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Harel Du Marais
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner for new stable in March and still in good form; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Has a tendency to race a bit too freely but started off for the Pogson stable with two C&D wins (both on good to soft) in March and has also performed well on good ground on all three subsequent appearances; likely to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Beny Nahar Road
runners.comment: Backed up his game Sedgefield win in April but keeping-on third at Hexham last month
runners.spotlight: Kept on gamely to open chasing account at Sedgefield (2m3f, good) in April, his fourth attempt, and stuck to his task very well when third at Hexham (1m7f, good) last month; probably won't be far away.

stable_tour.quote: We did not get him out until December but the benefit of a run for a youngster is huge and he ran a good race when a neck second at Chelmsford. He has run twice this year going down close each time and he will not be long in getting his head front. We will run him on the all-weather as he is not going to get the soft ground h e needs. I would think 1m6f will be his trip. 15-08-22

runners.name: Gower Prince

prev_owners.owner: Jan Johnson&yor Gunna Be Lucky Syndicate

runners.comment: In front before last-fence fall at Chepstow two starts ago but has since performed poorly
runners.spotlight: Won for Nigel Twiston-Davies at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in spring 2024 and, having rejoined Matt Sheppard, was in front before last-fence fall at Chepstow (2m, good) in April; has claims if judged on that evidence but needs to bounce back from last month's poor performance.

runners.name: Delpotro
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin & Ecurie Horse Avenir

runners.comment: Opened British success with ready win from the front at Sedgefield last month
runners.spotlight: Free-going front-runner who was a dual chase winner in France last spring and opened his British account with ready success under Sean Bowen at Sedgefield (2m, good to firm) three weeks ago; 7lb higher here but could plausibly have more to offer.

runners.name: Neigh Botha
runners.comment: C&D winner; below form over hurdles last time but previously gave good account over fences
runners.spotlight: Below form when back over hurdles last month but gave very good account when clear second to all-the-way winner in Bangor chase (2m1f, good) two starts ago and will be suited by the return to this C&D.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Musselburgh for Donald Whillans before joining us. He ran well enough in a maiden hurdle at Listowel last month but will come on a ton for that and leave that form well behind. 18-10-22

runners.name: Jaitroplaclasse
runners.breeder: David Lumet & Dr V Catherine Lumet
runners.comment: Second to a revitalised subsequent winner last month; big player off same mark here
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who has been placed on two of his four starts for Robbie Llewellyn, more recently when second to a revitalised subsequent winner at Bangor (2m1f, good) last month; can make his presence felt off same mark here.

stable_tour.quote: Michael Blencowe hasn't had much luck for us and I was hoping this fella, who is beautiful, would change that, but he disappointed at Kempton in March. He looks the part and we just need to unlock his talent. 30-10-23

4:30.race_name: Golf And Gallop Package 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Series Qual') (GBB)
4:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Chief Ohara
runners.comment: Left clear to win a maiden point last month but the form is probably not worth much
runners.spotlight: Showed very little over hurdles when trained in Ireland by John McConnell last year; left clear to win a British point last month but that form is probably not worth much; best watched on debut for latest new trainer.

runners.name: Delgany Bobby Blue
runners.comment: In frame all four hurdling starts in 2023-24 season; big player if tuned up after layoff
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on all four hurdling starts during 2023-24 season, most recently when third in Wetherby handicap (3m, soft); not sure to be suited by the quicker ground here but should cope with the drop back in trip; major player if fully tuned up after 507-day absence.

runners.name: Don Virginia
runners.comment: Not making any progress but has been placed on five of seven hurdling starts; respected
runners.spotlight: Placed on five of his seven hurdling starts; does not appear to be making any progress but went down fighting when second at Hereford (2m3f, good; front pair well clear) last month and is a leading contender here.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Listed bumper winner Kel Du Large on his debut over hurdles at Hereford in February and should have won at Warwick two runs ago when he was impeded after the last. He stayed on well at the finish on his latest run at Carlisle and is probably still a little bit weak. He'll appreciate a step up in trip and we'll look for a suitable handicap. He's only four and should improve as he strengthens up. 06-11-24

runners.name: Idamix
runners.breeder: Mrs Benedicte Charoy & Mr Feycal Zabat
runners.comment: Well beaten (albeit on soft ground) on stable/hurdle debut in January
runners.spotlight: Made fairly encouraging bumper debut for Kim Bailey in April 2023 but wasn't seen again until 66l defeat in Huntingdon maiden hurdle (2m, soft) for new stable in January; moves up in trip here.

runners.name: Itaintmebabe
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and on hurdling debut (2m) this year
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in good-ground Irish point last November but well beaten in a bumper and on hurdling debut (2m) this year.

runners.name: Maggies Boy
runners.comment: Close up in two handicaps this spring and lost out only narrowly in recent Cartmel maiden
runners.spotlight: Looks exposed after eight hurdling starts but finished close up in two Perth handicaps this spring (3m/3m2f) and lost out only by a head in Cartmel maiden (2m6f, good) ten days ago; respected.

runners.name: Tchoupinminzac
runners.comment: Well beaten in two handicaps in April but booking of Sean Bowen catches the eye here
runners.spotlight: Two-time bumper winner who was runner-up in a 2m maiden hurdle at Worcester in May 2023; well below that form since returning from long absence in January, with his two handicap runs in April particularly disappointing, but the booking of Sean Bowen catches the eye here.

quotes.race: Cazoo Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tchoupinminzac did that really nicely. We had the run of the race but he had the experience and we made it count - Charlie Hammond, jockey.

runners.name: Wistmans Prince
runners.comment: Struggled on both hurdling starts for new stable this year
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper for Fergal O'Brien in April 2024 and also struggled in two hurdle races for new stable this year (2m3f/2m7f).

runners.name: Built By Rossies
runners.comment: Showed some hurdling ability in Ireland and won a British point in February; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Showed significant hurdling ability in Ireland last year and won a British point (2m4f, soft) on latest outing in February; should be fine back on good ground and has a decent chance on this stable debut.

runners.name: Dartmouth Star
runners.comment: Well beaten when 80-1 for first two hurdle runs (2m/2m4f)
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when 80-1 for first two hurdle runs, both at Hexham last month (2m/2m4f).

5:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Aazza
runners.comment: Ended last season with two wins (one over C&D) and again ran well on latest outing
runners.spotlight: Revitalised 9yo who ended last season with two good-ground wins (one over C&D) and posted another good effort when second to progressive rival at Bangor (2m7f, good) last month; obvious contender in current form.

runners.name: Champetre
runners.comment: Consistent in early part of last season and ran quite well last month, after a break
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles but was very consistent at around 3m on good/good to soft ground in early part of last season and ran well for a long way when back in action last month; big player if that recent outing brought him on.

stable_tour.quote: We'll be looking to get him in for a late spring/early summer campaign over fences. We schooled him earlier this year and he's been jumping more confidently over fences. 18-12-24

runners.name: Zarhanya
runners.comment: Made low-key handicap debut over 2m3f; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Still unexposed after only four hurdling starts and has the services of Sean Bowen today but made rather underwhelming handicap debut over 2m3f six weeks ago and is not bred to benefit from this step up in trip.

runners.name: Zoffalee
runners.comment: Returned from long absence with fairly encouraging run last month; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old form and returned from 707-day absence with reasonably encouraging hurdle run last month; needs to build on that performance here but runs this track well and is suited by good ground.

quotes.race: Flynn Hotels Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zoffalee has had a good week and we'll have to head to Listowel for the Lartigue after that. It's worth so much we'll have to give it a go - Andy McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Burleigh Accountancy Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a nice pot for him to win and he's entered at Tramore on Thursday. He might go there for the same money under a penalty- Andrew McNamara, trainer

quotes.race: Bank Of Ireland Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We'll see what the handicapper does to Zoffalee and see where we go. He has done a good bit of schooling over fences so we might take in a chase as a four-year-old as they get good allowances - Andy McNamara, trainer

quotes.race: Caldwell Construction/EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a nice horse and we were a bit disappointed with his first run. He's a three-year-old in the making so there's no rush, but as he's French bred, we might go for a conditions race at Deauville - trainer Tom Dascombe

runners.name: Global Assembly
runners.comment: Out of sorts over fences last season; makes hurdling debut today; had wind op last month
runners.spotlight: Former Irish pointer/hunter chaser; looked badly out of sorts in handicap chases for new stable last season (four starts) and it takes a big leap of faith to support him on this hurdle debut; had wind op last month; swaps visor for refitted blinkers.

runners.name: Horizon Dor
runners.breeder: Mrs A Baudrelle & Mrs S Rousselle
runners.comment: Absent since disappointing chase debut in December; now with new stable
runners.spotlight: Ran big race in defeat for Adam West at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) in the autumn but we haven't seen him since his disappointing chase debut in December; makes stable debut today; market may guide.

runners.name: Big Bee Hive
runners.comment: Not firing on all cylinders over fences this year; back hurdling with a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner (2m3f-3m1f, good-soft) who is usually ridden very patiently; switches back to hurdling on a tempting mark but has not been firing on all cylinders this year.

quotes.race: Cannonwood Handicap Hurdle (Rated 80-95)
quotes.quote: Big Bee Hive ran a blinder at Punchestown last time for Phidelma (Elvin). He won't go on summer ground and he probably doesn't handle heavy. I would say he'll improve and hopefully we can find another little race for him - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He doesn't like pressure and has taken time. Jonathan: He's only just started to get things together and last time out, when he finished third at Sedgefield, was the first time he's shown signs there might be races to win with him. He'll appreciate nicer ground and will probably go chasing in the spring, but he should be able to win off 84. I rode him to give him every chance to get 2m4f last time, but he'll probably stay further. 08-02-24

runners.name: Rubies Or Gold

prev_owners.owner: Patrick M Hogan & F W Healy & Ms Margaret Mullins

runners.comment: Only third when well supported for last two races and now 0-10 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify strong market support when only third on his two starts this spring (2m7f/3m1f) and now 0-10 over hurdles; needs to find something extra here.

runners.name: Fantomas
runners.comment: Suited by this C&D but has performed poorly on all four appearances since last June
runners.spotlight: Battled on well to score off 5lb higher at Hereford (3m1f, good) in March 2024 and is also suited by this C&D but has performed poorly on all four appearances since last June and needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Even Break
runners.comment: Well beaten over fences in first two handicaps; headgear added for handicap hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten over fences in his first two handicaps (3m1f/2m5f); fitted with first-time tongue-tie/blinkers for this handicap hurdle debut; huge improvement required.

runners.name: Belladinotte
runners.comment: Safely held on last year's handicap debut and didn't show much in two points this spring
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on handicap debut for Mark Walford last June (2m7f) and showed very little in two maiden points for owner-trainer this spring; now in the care of Sara Ender; 1lb wrong; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Stripe Of Honour
runners.comment: Suited by this C&D but his infrequent going days are hard to predict; 4lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with close second over C&D (soft; also suited by good ground) last spring but has been out of form since and his infrequent going days are hard to predict; 4lb out of the weights today.

runners.name: Top Drawer
runners.comment: Remote when third of four at Ludlow (3m, good) and now 0-22; can't be recommended
runners.spotlight: Remote when third of four at Ludlow (3m, good) last month and now 0-22 over hurdles; 8lb out of the handicap here and can't be recommended; cheekpieces (worn twice previously) given another whirl.

4:00.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap Hurdle
4:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Max Of Stars
runners.owner: Mrs S D Pearson & Ollie Pears
runners.comment: Ended last season with some underwhelming efforts but too well handicapped to rule out
runners.spotlight: Free-going mare who is yet to add to her four hurdling wins in 2023 and ended last season with some underwhelming efforts; didn't run badly on the Flat last month, though, and has become too well handicapped to rule out.

quotes.race: Smokey Joe Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Max Of Stars is a good mare and that's the best she's run. She's always been a keen-going sort, but she's never finished better than she did today. She's off to Wetherby now (for the Listed Wensleydale Juvenile Hurdle on November 3rd) and then she'll have a break. I can see her going back on the Flat in March before going back over hurdles and then we're thinking about maybe going over fences. She's a horse with a massive amount of upside and a lot of options - Ollie Pears, trainer.

quotes.race: Lee Pollard 60th Birthday Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That's a big chunk of an allowance to get [18lb]. Max Of Stars does have Flat speed but couldn't win on the Flat because she was too keen. She was keen today as well but enjoys jumping and is big for a 3yo filly. At Newton Abbot she ran away with me and had everything burned off by halfway. To be fair to them the opposition is fairly exposed today and she was the unexposed one - Brian Hughes, rider, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Zucayan
runners.comment: Clearcut winner at Ludlow last month; up 5lb and away from his favourite track today
runners.spotlight: Gained all three wins at Ludlow (2m, good), most recently when keeping on too strongly for Wasthatok last month; up 5lb to career-high mark today, though, and away from his favourite track this time.

quotes.race: Racing To School Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zucayan travelled very strongly and jumped the best he's jumped apart from two out, when he nearly took it with us. We always thought he had a good engine but his jumping didn't help in those novice hurdles - Nick Slatter, jockey.

runners.name: Zafaan
runners.comment: Placed on first two hurdling starts but not obviously well treated for this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Has a lowly Flat rating nowadays; took surprisingly well to hurdling for new stable during the winter, finishing third over C&D and at Fakenham (also good to soft), but was well below that form when back at Fakenham in March and is not obviously well treated for this handicap hurdle debut.

runners.name: Wasthatok
runners.comment: Chased home Zucayan at Ludlow last month; might turn the tables with him here
runners.spotlight: Lacked the pace of Zucayan on run-in at Ludlow (2m, good) last month but that second was still a good effort; 5lb better off with him today and will probably be the better suited by the change of venue for this rematch.

runners.name: Zenato

prev_owners.owner: The Trip To Syndicate And Partners

runners.comment: Rallied well to win Fakenham maiden six weeks ago; has a bit more on his plate here
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who came good over hurdles at fourth attempt, digging deep to regain lead on run-in at Fakenham (2m, good) six weeks ago; has more on his plate now back in a handicap but further progress is possible.

quotes.race: Fairfax & Favor Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zenato was very free when he came to us off the Flat. We're still getting to know him. I thought he was beaten and he had to be tough ? he showed a great attitude. It sometimes takes horses a few runs to adjust, but hopefully he'll take confidence from that experience - Jonathan Burke, jockey.

runners.name: Play Pretend
runners.comment: Did not kick on from last spring's fortunate debut win; makes handicap debut after layoff
runners.spotlight: Fortunate when winning against own age-group on debut at Market Rasen (2m, good) last June and did not really kick on from that success afterwards; makes handicap debut after six-month break; others preferred.

runners.name: Knight Of Magic
runners.comment: Lowly rated Flat maiden; yet to show anything more than glimmers of hurdling promise
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated Flat maiden who is yet to show anything more than glimmers of promise over hurdles and was beaten over 40l after racing too freely on handicap debut at Sedgefield (1m7f, good to soft) in January.

3:30.race_name: Join Southwell Golf Club Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
3:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.0) (Watering)

runners.name: Georgies Malt
runners.comment: Not beaten far when fourth at Hexham, and that race was probably stronger than this
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to useful hurdler Master Malt; beaten only about 5l when fourth of six in what was probably a stronger race than this at Hexham (good) last month; one to consider.

runners.name: Hard Market
runners.comment: Never dangerous when fourth at Plumpton in April but open to improvement here
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a significant blow from off the pace when fourth of nine at Plumpton (good) in April but significant positives can still be drawn from that performance, and her stable has a good bumper strike-rate (16%); tongue-tie added here.

runners.name: Rosie Baloo
runners.comment: Half-sister to connections' bumper/useful jumps winner Betty Baloo; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-sister to connections' bumper/useful jumps winner Betty Baloo, their fairly useful jumper Milly Baloo and two other jumps winners; dam 2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner; trainer doesn't run many in bumpers; market may guide.

runners.name: Take A Glance
runners.comment: 0-5 in maiden points and makes only limited appeal on this rules debut
runners.spotlight: 0-5 in points; appeared to display some improvement when third in recent Hexham maiden (good ground; first-time cheekpieces) but still makes only limited appeal on this rules debut.

runners.name: Burlington Place
runners.comment: Out of a half-sister to a Group 3 Flat winner; stable not known for bumper success
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; first foal; dam placed over 7f/1m on the Flat (RPR 76), half-sister to 7f Group 3 winner Regal Realm; stable 0-8 in bumpers during last five seasons (all runners unplaced).

runners.name: Dyadoras Destiny
runners.comment: Half-sister to a fairly useful Irish hurder; stable not prolific in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; sister to a low-grade chase winner, half-sister to bumper/fairly useful Irish hurdle winner Choice Of Words and two fair hurdlers; dam fair chaser; stable 1-17 in bumpers during last five seasons.

runners.name: For Love Of Beauty
runners.comment: Raced too freely when fifth of nine at Fakenham but that run was not devoid of promise
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred filly; raced too freely and did not look entirely straightforward when fifth of nine at Fakenham (good ground; tongue tied) six weeks ago but that run certainly wasn't devoid of promise.

runners.name: Ladies Day
runners.comment: Point bumper winner; ran quite well on rules debut; has significant role to play here
runners.spotlight: Comfortably won good-ground point bumper on debut in March and was very respectable third of five on last month's rules debut at Warwick (good); ought to play a significant role here.

runners.name: Serenarella
runners.comment: Out of an unraced sister to smart hurdler Cinders And Ashes; stable quiet in bumpers
runners.spotlight: 3,000euros 3yo; fifth foal; closely related to a hurdle winner; dam unraced sister to a 7f Flat winner, half-sister to smart bumper/hurdle winner Cinders And Ashes; stable not known for bumper success.
